channel.title: Comments on: SQL Server DBA Tip 4 – Server Considerations â€“ 32 bit / 64 bit
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.dc:creator: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.content:encoded:
Fixed? OLEDB Jet support wasn’t broken, it just wasn’t going to be provided for 64bit. Use the office system driver or express (or compact) as MS recommends or run in 32bit mode but that is kind of a different topic ðŸ™‚

http://blogs.msdn.com/b/psssql/archive/2010/01/21/how-to-get-a-x64-version-of-jet.aspx

http://support.microsoft.com/kb/957570

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/en/details.aspx?familyid=C06B8369-60DD-4B64-A44B-84B371EDE16D&displaylang=en

http://www.confio.com/ have good products that allow it though.

item.title: By: David Forck (thirster42)

item.description: have they fixed the issue with excel/access and the 64-bit driver?
item.content:encoded: have they fixed the issue with excel/access and the 64-bit driver?

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: I still have 2 ETL servers on 32 bit because they have to pull data from FoxPro
item.content:encoded: I still have 2 ETL servers on 32 bit because they have to pull data from FoxPro

item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.dc:creator: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.description: I won't miss the question of, "Should I have the /PAE and the /3GB switch in the boot.ini????" Mostly when Win 2003 Server came out.
item.content:encoded: I won’t miss the question of, “Should I have the /PAE and the /3GB switch in the boot.ini????” Mostly when Win 2003 Server came out.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Yep, the days of /3GB are over
